issues.name: PHD Registration
reply: PhD registration is handled at the PhD Office from Monday to Friday during office hours.
You can apply for PhD registration via the university's online portal or visit the PhD Office.
For more details on PhD enrolment, check the official PhD registration guidelines at https://www.uni.lu/research-en/doctoral-education/

issues.name: Withdrawal from the university
reply: If you are considering withdrawing from the university, please consult the Student Affairs Office for guidance on the process.

Students seeking information on academic withdrawal, temporary leave, or expulsion policies should contact https://www.uni.lu/en/education/academic-matters/student-status/change-or-withdrawal-from-programme/

For official procedures on leaving the university, including necessary documentation and deadlines, visit https://www.uni.lu/en/education/academic-matters/student-status/change-or-withdrawal-from-programme/

If you are facing disciplinary issues, schedule a consultation with the Student Disciplinary Office or check https://www.uni.lu/en/education/academic-matters/student-status/change-or-withdrawal-from-programme/

issues.name: Housing
reply: For housing assistance, please visit the Student Housing Office or email https://www.uni.lu/life-en/accommodation/
Student accommodation details, including contracts and renewals, are available at https://www.uni.lu/life-en/accommodation/
If you're looking for a student residence, check the latest updates at https://www.uni.lu/life-en/accommodation/

issues.name: Enrolment
reply: New student enrolment is handled via https://www.uni.lu/en/admissions/ Visit the portal for step-by-step instructions.
If you are applying for a Bachelor's or Master's program, submit your documents online at https://www.uni.lu/en/admissions/
Check https://www.uni.lu/en/admissions/ for deadlines, requirements, and procedures regarding student enrolment.

issues.name: Reenrolment
reply: Reenrolment is required for continuing students. Visit https://www.uni.lu/en/admissions/reenrolment/ for the latest instructions.
To continue your studies, submit your reenrolment application before the deadline at https://www.uni.lu/en/admissions/reenrolment/
Reenrolment guidelines, including required documents, can be found at https://www.uni.lu/en/admissions/reenrolment/

issues.name: Residence permit
reply: Residence permit updates are handled by the International Office. Visit https://affluences.com/universite-du-luxembourg-1/universite-du-luxembourg/reservation/ for requirements.
If you need to renew your permit, check the latest guidelines at https://affluences.com/universite-du-luxembourg-1/universite-du-luxembourg/reservation/
For residence permit extension and required documents, consult the Admissions Office.

issues.name: Mobility
reply: If you are interested in exchange programs like Erasmus, visit the International Mobility Office or check https://www.uni.lu/en/mobility/outgoing-student-mobility/
The university offers international exchange opportunities. Learn more at https://www.uni.lu/en/mobility/outgoing-student-mobility/
For details on eligibility, application deadlines, and partner universities, visit the Mobility Office or contact mobility@uni.lu.

issues.name: Diploma retrieval
reply: If you have completed your studies and need to collect your diploma, visit the Registrar’s Office or check https://www.uni.lu/en/education/academic-matters/student-status/diploma/
Students can retrieve their diplomas by making an appointment at https://www.uni.lu/en/education/academic-matters/student-status/diploma/
For lost or duplicate diploma requests, contact the Academic Services Office at https://www.uni.lu/en/education/academic-matters/student-status/diploma/

issues.name: Graduation information
reply: The university’s graduation ceremonies are organized by the Academic Office. Check https://www.uni.lu/en/about/academic-calendar/graduation/ for details.
To register for the next graduation ceremony, visit the graduation portal or contact https://www.uni.lu/en/about/academic-calendar/graduation/
Graduation event dates, dress codes, and guest invitations are available at https://www.uni.lu/en/about/academic-calendar/graduation/

issues.name: Salary slips
reply: University employees and student workers can access salary slips via the HR portal at https://www.uni.lu/en/about/organisation/administration/hr-department/
If you need a printed copy of your salary slip, visit the Payroll Office during business hours.
For payroll-related questions, contact the Human Resources department at hr4u@uni.lu.

issues.name: CNS
reply: Students must register for CNS health insurance at https://www.uni.lu/life-en/moving-to-luxembourg/insurances/
If you need to update your CNS card, visit the Student Health Services Office or contact ccss@secu.lu
For CNS coverage details and medical reimbursement, refer to https://www.uni.lu/life-en/moving-to-luxembourg/insurances/ or call the Social Security Office.

issues.name: Library Access
reply: Library resources, including borrowing and study spaces, can be accessed at https://www.uni.lu/llc-en/ or phisically in the LLC
Check the library portal for book availability and loan policies.
For research materials and digital access, visit https://www.uni.lu/llc-en/

issues.name: IT Support
reply: For IT support, please contact the university IT Helpdesk at https://www.uni.lu/life-en/it-technology/
Technical issues such as login or network problems can be resolved by reaching out to the IT department.
Check the IT support website at https://www.uni.lu/life-en/it-technology/ for troubleshooting guides and assistance.

issues.name: Financial Aid
reply: For financial aid inquiries, visit the Financial Aid Office or check https://www.uni.lu/life-en/financial-support/scholarships/
The university offers various funding opportunities. Learn more at https://www.uni.lu/life-en/financial-support/scholarships/
Scholarship eligibility and application details are available on the Financial Aid portal.

greeting: Hello, what do you need help with?
Hi there, how can I assist you today?
Greetings, please let me know how I can help.
not_understand: I'm sorry, could you please clarify your question?
I don't understand the meaning of that..
Could you please provide more details?
I'm having trouble understanding, could you rephrase?
cannot_help: I'm sorry, but I'm afraid I can't help you today
Unfortunately, I'm not able to assist with that request.
I apologize, but that request is beyond my current capabilities.
more_help: Great, do you need my help with something else?
Is there anything else I can assist you with?
Feel free to ask if you have any more questions.
goodbye: Thank you for using our SEVE chatbot, don't hesitate to contact me if you have any other questions.
Thank you for reaching out, have a wonderful day!
